tasks.title: Add colorblind-friendly and high-contrast TUI themes
tasks.description:
Implement accessibility-focused themes for users with visual impairments. Current themes may not be accessible to users with color vision deficiencies.

New themes:
- High Contrast: Pure black/white with clear borders, WCAG AAA compliant
- Deuteranopia-friendly: Blue/yellow palette (red-green safe)
- Protanopia-friendly: Blue/orange palette (red-green safe)
- Tritanopia-friendly: Red/teal palette (blue-yellow safe)
- Monochrome: Patterns and intensity instead of color

Features:
- Theme preview in settings
- Automatic detection from terminal capabilities
- Custom color overrides per user
- Pattern/texture indicators (not just color)

Implementation adds new theme variants to existing theme system in crates/tui/src/ui/theme.rs.

Critical for inclusive design and accessibility compliance.
evidence: Current themes use color without pattern/texture alternatives
No accessibility settings in theme configuration
WCAG guidelines recommend not relying solely on color for information
plan: Add HighContrast theme variant with WCAG AAA colors
Add Monochrome theme using patterns and intensity
Add pattern indicators for critical states (not just color)
Add theme preview widget showing all semantic colors
Verify by running: splunk-tui, open Settings, cycle themes and checking contrast ratios
